definitions: sealed metal or plastic cylinder for storing food, gas, or other materials
examples: She opened a canister of coffee from the pantry shelf
The gas canister needs replacing before our camping trip

definitions: painful sore in the mouth or on lips
fungal or bacterial disease causing decay in plants
something that corrupts or destroys from within like a moral evil
examples: The canker sore made eating citrus fruits extremely painful
She applied medication to the canker on her inner cheek
Rose canker destroyed several bushes in the garden this year
The apple trees showed signs of canker on their branches
Corruption became a canker eating away at the government's legitimacy
Jealousy was a canker that destroyed their once strong friendship

definitions: factory where food is canned and preserved in sealed containers
examples: The salmon cannery employed hundreds during the fishing season
Workers at the cannery processed tomatoes sixteen hours daily

definitions: person who eats human flesh or an animal eating its own species
examples: Historical accounts described cannibals living on remote Pacific islands
The horror movie featured a tribe of cannibals in the jungle

definitions: practice of eating flesh of one's own species, especially human consumption of humans
examples: Cannibalism occurred during extreme famine conditions throughout history
Some spider species practice cannibalism after mating rituals

definitions: large heavy gun firing solid projectiles, typically mounted on wheels
billiards shot where cue ball strikes two other balls successively
examples: The fortress cannons fired at approaching enemy ships
Civil War cannons are displayed outside the military museum
He executed a perfect cannon to score three points
The cannon shot required precise angle calculation

definitions: heavy metal ball fired from a cannon as ammunition
diving position with knees pulled tight against chest
examples: The cannonball crashed through the castle's stone wall
Archaeologists discovered cannonballs from the colonial battle
He did a cannonball off the high diving board
The kids competed to make the biggest cannonball splash

definitions: lightweight narrow boat pointed at both ends, propelled with paddles
examples: They paddled the canoe across the peaceful lake
The aluminum canoe tipped over in the rapids

definitions: person who paddles or races in canoes as sport or recreation
examples: The experienced canoeist navigated the whitewater expertly
Olympic canoeists train six hours daily for competitions

definitions: variety of rapeseed plant producing oil low in erucic acid
examples: Farmers planted canola in rotation with wheat crops
Canola oil has become popular for healthy cooking

definitions: collection of sacred books accepted as genuine scripture
works of an author or artist accepted as authentic
member of clergy on cathedral or collegiate church staff
musical composition where melody is repeated by different voices
examples: The biblical canon was established over many centuries
These texts are not part of the official canon
Shakespeare's canon includes thirty-seven plays and numerous sonnets
Critics debate whether this painting belongs in Vermeer's canon
The canon conducted morning prayers at the cathedral
She was appointed canon of Westminster Abbey
Bach composed many intricate canons demonstrating contrapuntal mastery
The children sang the canon in three-part harmony

definitions: official process by which someone is declared a saint in the Catholic Church
examples: Mother Teresa's canonisation drew thousands to Vatican City
The canonisation process requires proof of two miracles

definitions: official process by which someone is declared a saint in the Catholic Church
examples: The pope presided over the canonization ceremony yesterday
Joan of Arc's canonization occurred centuries after her death

definitions: cloth covering suspended or extending over something as shelter
uppermost branches of trees in forest forming continuous layer
fabric part of a parachute that catches air during descent
examples: The wedding reception featured a white canopy decorated with flowers
They installed a canopy over the outdoor seating area
Monkeys rarely descend from the rainforest canopy
The dense canopy blocked most sunlight from reaching ground
The parachute canopy failed to open properly during descent
She checked the canopy lines before jumping

definitions: hypocritical or sanctimonious talk about moral or religious matters
slanting or tilted position or angle of something
specialized vocabulary or jargon of a particular group
examples: His speech was full of political cant about family values
She despised the cant of self-righteous reformers
The ship developed a dangerous cant to starboard
The tower has a noticeable cant from its foundation
Thieves' cant was incomprehensible to ordinary citizens
Medical cant often confuses patients unnecessarily

definitions: medium-length narrative piece of music for voices with instrumental accompaniment
examples: Bach's Christmas cantata filled the cathedral with joy
The choir rehearsed the cantata for three months

definitions: restaurant or cafeteria in workplace, school, or military base
portable water bottle used by soldiers, campers, or hikers
box containing set of cutlery and dining utensils
examples: Students ate lunch in the school canteen every weekday
The factory canteen served subsidized meals to workers
His army canteen held enough water for the march
She filled her canteen at the mountain stream
The silver canteen was a wedding gift from her grandmother
The antique canteen contained service for twelve people

definitions: three-beat gait of a horse faster than trot but slower than gallop
examples: The horse broke into an easy canter along the trail
She practiced maintaining balance during the canter

definitions: hymn or chant forming part of church service, typically with biblical text
examples: The monks sang canticles during evening prayers
The Canticle of Mary is recited at vespers

definitions: rigid structural element anchored at one end extending horizontally into space
examples: The cantilever bridge spans the river without center supports
Modern cantilever designs allow dramatic architectural overhangs

definitions: major division or section of a long poem, especially an epic
examples: Dante's Inferno contains thirty-four cantos describing hell
She memorized the opening canto of Paradise Lost

definitions: political or administrative division of a country, especially in Switzerland
square division in upper corner of heraldic shield or flag
examples: The Swiss canton of Geneva borders France
Each canton maintains considerable autonomy in Switzerland
The flag's canton displayed the union jack design
Heraldic rules govern what appears in the canton

definitions: temporary or semi-permanent military quarters for troops
examples: British cantonments in India housed colonial military forces
The army established a cantonment near the border

definitions: person who leads singing or chanting in synagogue or church services
examples: The cantor's voice filled the synagogue during Yom Kippur
She trained for years to become a professional cantor

definitions: systematic soliciting of votes, opinions, or orders by going door to door
examples: Political canvassing intensified before the election
Volunteers spent weekends canvassing for charitable donations

definitions: deep gorge with steep sides, typically formed by river erosion
examples: The Grand Canyon attracts millions of tourists annually
They hiked through the narrow canyon following the stream

definitions: soft flat hat with a visor, or any head covering
upper limit or maximum amount allowed or possible
protective cover or top for a bottle, tube, or container
examples: He wore a baseball cap to shield his eyes from sun
The nurse wore a surgical cap in the operating room
The government imposed a cap on carbon emissions
There's a cap of fifty students per class
She twisted off the bottle cap to pour a drink
Replace the cap tightly after using the medicine

definitions: power or ability to do something; capacity for achievement or use
examples: The software's capabilities exceeded our initial expectations
Military capability depends on training and equipment

definitions: electronic component that stores electrical energy in an electric field
examples: The capacitor failed causing the motor to stop
Large capacitors store energy for the flash unit

definitions: maximum amount that something can contain or produce
ability or power to do, experience, or understand something
position or role in which someone functions
examples: The stadium has a capacity of fifty thousand spectators
The tank's capacity is two hundred gallons
She demonstrated remarkable capacity for learning languages
His capacity for empathy made him an excellent counselor
She served in her capacity as board chairperson
Acting in his official capacity, the mayor signed the decree

definitions: sleeveless cloak fastened at neck hanging over shoulders
headland or promontory extending into body of water
examples: The superhero's red cape billowed in the wind
She wore a velvet cape to the opera
Ships navigate carefully around the Cape of Good Hope
The lighthouse stands on the rocky cape

definitions: playful skipping movement or lighthearted adventure
pickled flower bud used as seasoning in cooking
illicit or ridiculous activity, especially a crime
examples: Children's capers in the playground delighted their parents
The movie depicted their capers across Europe
She added capers to the salmon for extra flavor
Mediterranean dishes often feature capers and olives
The bank caper went wrong when alarms sounded
Police investigated the jewel heist caper for months

definitions: smallest blood vessel connecting arteries and veins
tube with very small internal diameter
examples: Oxygen passes through capillary walls into body tissues
Broken capillaries appeared as red marks on her cheeks
The capillary tube drew liquid upward by surface tension
Scientists used glass capillaries in the experiment

definitions: city serving as seat of government for country or region
wealth in money or property owned or used in business
uppercase letter used at beginning of sentences and proper nouns
decorative top part of architectural column or pillar
examples: Paris is the capital of France
The state capital houses the legislature
They raised capital to start their new business
The company needs more capital for expansion
Always write proper names with capital letters
Begin each sentence with a capital
The Corinthian capital features elaborate acanthus leaves
Stone capitals topped the ancient temple columns

definitions: total market value of a company's outstanding shares
practice of writing with capital letters according to rules
examples: The company's capitalisation exceeded ten billion dollars
Market capitalisation fluctuates with stock prices
Proper capitalisation improves document readability
Students learned capitalisation rules in grammar class

definitions: economic system based on private ownership of means of production and operation for profit
examples: Capitalism encourages competition and entrepreneurship
Critics argue capitalism increases wealth inequality

definitions: person who has capital invested in business or who owns means of production
person who supports or believes in principles of capitalism
examples: Venture capitalists funded numerous tech startups
The wealthy capitalist owned several factories
She identified as a capitalist despite growing inequality
Capitalists argue free markets drive innovation

definitions: total market value of a company's outstanding shares
practice of writing with capital letters according to rules
examples: Apple's capitalization surpassed two trillion dollars
Small capitalization stocks carry higher risk
Check your capitalization before submitting the essay
Capitalization errors marked the amateur writing

definitions: building housing a legislative body, especially the US Congress building
examples: Protesters gathered on the Capitol steps in Washington
The state capitol underwent extensive renovation

definitions: action of surrendering or giving up resistance; complete defeat
examples: The army's capitulation ended the six-month siege
His capitulation to their demands surprised everyone

definitions: clamp fastened across guitar strings to raise pitch
high-ranking member of organized crime family
examples: Place the capo on the third fret to change key
The guitarist adjusted the capo between songs
The capo controlled illegal gambling in that district
FBI agents surveilled the mafia capo for months

definitions: male chicken castrated to improve meat quality for eating
examples: The restaurant served roasted capon for the holiday feast
Capons produce more tender meat than regular roosters

definitions: espresso coffee topped with steamed milk foam
examples: She ordered a cappuccino with extra foam
The barista created leaf art in the cappuccino foam

definitions: sudden unaccountable change of mood or behavior; whim
examples: Her caprices made her difficult to work with
The weather's caprice ruined our outdoor plans

definitions: chemical compound in chili peppers that produces burning sensation
examples: Capsaicin gives jalapeños their characteristic heat
Medical creams containing capsaicin relieve arthritis pain

definitions: tropical plant bearing peppers, including bell peppers and chili peppers
examples: Red capsicum adds color and sweetness to salads
Farmers grew various capsicum varieties in greenhouses

definitions: overturning of a boat or ship in water
examples: The yacht's capsizing left three sailors in the water
Preventing capsizing requires proper weight distribution

definitions: rotating machine used for winding ropes or cables, especially on ships
examples: Sailors turned the capstan to raise the heavy anchor
The wooden capstan showed centuries of wear

definitions: stone placed at top of wall or building structure
crowning achievement or final accomplishment in career or project
examples: Workers carefully positioned the pyramid's capstone
The granite capstone protected the wall from rain
This research represents the capstone of her career
The treaty was the capstone of diplomatic efforts

definitions: small soluble case containing dose of medicine
compartment for crew and instruments in spacecraft
compact container or case for items
examples: Take one capsule twice daily with meals
The gelatin capsule dissolves in the stomach
The space capsule splashed down in the Pacific
Astronauts trained in the capsule simulator
Time capsules preserve artifacts for future generations
The hotel offers sleeping capsules for budget travelers
